pullRequest.body:
This PR adds some definitional lemmas for `ContinuousMonoidHom` and `ContinuousAddMonoidHom`.

It also defines two functions.
1. Given an additive topological group `A` and a topological space `X`, it defines the constant homomorphism `constₜ : A →ₜ+ C(G,A)`.
3. Give a continuous homomorphism `f : A →ₜ+ B` and a topological space `X`, it defines the homomorphism `mapₜ f : C(X,A) →ₜ+ C(X,B)`.

I intend to use these functions to define continuous group cohomology in the following way.
Let `G` be a topological group and `A` a continuous representation of `G`. Then there is an exact sequence of additive
topological groups:
$$0 \to A \to C(G,A) \to C(G,C(G,A)) \to C(G,C(G,C(G,A))) \to \ldots .$$
The maps in this sequence are defined recursively. The first map `A →ₜ+ C(G,A)` is `constₜ`.
If the `n`-th map in the sequence is `d`, then the `n+1`-th map is `constₜ - mapₜ d`.

In the case that `G` is locally compact, there is a continuous action of `G` on each term in the sequence. If we take the `G`-invariants, then we obtain a cochain complex whose cohomology groups are the continuous cohomology of `G`.

The definition of the maps in the exact sequence is equivalent to the usual definition of coboundary maps as alternating sums, but the proof of exactness is simpler using the recursive definition.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f851eeb8c9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21300/commits/f851eeb8c9607eb33e1e1c3774330355eb44fa56)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : CommMonoid (A →ₜ* E)`
`+ instance : ConcreteCategory ProfiniteGrp (fun X Y => X →ₜ* Y)`
`+ instance : Inhabited (A →ₜ* B) := ⟨1⟩`
`+ instance : One (A →ₜ* B)`
`+ instance [MonoidHomClass F A B] [ContinuousMapClass F A B] : CoeOut F (A →ₜ* B)`
`- instance : CommMonoid (ContinuousMonoidHom A E)`
`- instance : ConcreteCategory ProfiniteGrp (fun X Y => ContinuousMonoidHom X Y)`
`- instance : Inhabited (ContinuousMonoidHom A B) := ⟨1⟩`
`- instance : One (ContinuousMonoidHom A B)`
`- instance [MonoidHomClass F A B] [ContinuousMapClass F A B] : CoeOut F (ContinuousMonoidHom A B)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> The definition of the maps in the exact sequence is equivalent to the usual definition of coboundary maps as alternating sums, but the proof of exactness is simpler using the recursive definition.

This looks interesting, but alternatively, is not it possible to observe that the homotopy equivalence that is constructed in the "discrete" case is compatible with the continuity conditions on cochains? I am not too much into the algebra/topology parts of mathlib, but I would think it would also be important that we can easily relate continuous cochains and cochains (in the discrete case), which may be a difficulty with the inductive definition. Could you introduce a discussion on Zulip about the design, because some other people (typically from the FLT-project) may have various ideas on how to implement continuous cohomology?

Many thanks for your comments. Where would I discuss this on zulip (sorry, but I'm not very familiar with zulip)?

On your specific point about relating continuous cohomology to cohomology of discrete groups, one can certainly define a map from continuous cohomology to discrete group cohomology given by a map of cochain complexes.

In Mathlib, discrete group cohomology is defined using inhomogeneous cocycles. If one took this approach with continuous cohomology and insisted that the inhomogeneous cocycles are continuous, then this would impose an unnecessary restriction on the representation (a stronger continuity condition than is needed). The definition using continuous homogeneous cocycles is more general.
Can you fix the merge conflict? I would start a discussion about the definition of continuous group cohomology in #mathlib4 , outlining your ideas. But this PR seems uncontentious enough.
Thanks for your comments. I'll say something on zulip about continuous cohomology.

Since making this PR, I've switched from continuous cohomology with a base ring Int to continuous cohomology with a general base ring. Because of this, I actually need API for ContinuousLinearMap instead of ContinuousAddMonoidHom, so I have remove a few things from the original PR

I think that (unfortunately) the correct way to proceed with this is to have one PR which does nothing other than adding the notation, and which then adds/uses the notation throughout mathlib rather than just in one file.
@jcommelin what do you think?
Sounds good to me, but I guess we should also ask @j-loreaux and @ADedecker. They will be much more frequent users of such notation...

> I think that (unfortunately) the correct way to proceed with this is to have one PR which does nothing other than adding the notation, and which then adds/uses the notation throughout mathlib rather than just in one file.

I think I've made those changes now.

Can you change the PR description so it accurately describes what's happening in this PR?

Thanks a lot, I think this is definitely a good change.

bors d+

:v: rmhi can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

pullRequest.title: feat(ContinuousMonoidHom/ContinuousCohomology): add some API for use in definition of continuous group cohomology
